str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
From akron and probably a modified form of posthe; the prepuce; by implication, an uncircumcised state or person.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have strength, be strong, be in full health and vigor, be able; meton: I prevail. From ischus; to have force.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From energes; to be active, efficient.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
